alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 5:11AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Threat for snow squalls late this afternoon and evening... A cold front will move eastward across Utah and southwest Wyoming this evening. This cold front will aid in the development of scattered, locally heavy snow showers and snow squalls from late this afternoon through this evening. These snow showers and squalls will be capable of causing low visibility, rapid changes in visibility, gusty winds and difficult driving conditions. These conditions have the potential of impacting the Wednesday evening commute. Those with travel plans late this afternoon and evening should continue to monitor the latest forecasts. For more information from NOAA/s National Weather Service visit... http://weather.gov/saltlakecity For information on potential travel impacts visit... http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx
